newsitem.title: FINLAND: MERITA SAYS JEFFERSONVILLE CASE GROUNDLESS.
newsitem.headline: MERITA SAYS JEFFERSONVILLE CASE GROUNDLESS.

text.p: Finnish banking group Merita Oy said a case against it and its banking subsidiary Merita Oy brought to a United Statres court by the city of Jeffersonville in the U.S. was groundless and could not succeed.

"The lawsuit is linked to the bankruptcy of Haka Oy," Merita said, referring to a Finnish construction company. Haka's former U.S. subsidiary Haka Inc's subsidiary Ohio Riverside Development Cooperation had been building on a site it owned in Jeffersonville, Merita said, but gave no details.

"Based on the information available Merita finds the lawsuit groundless. Merita and Merita Bank have not done anything or neglected to do something which could have given reason to bring the lawsuit. The group thinks that the lawsuit has no possibilities to succeed," Merita said.
